column1: #Text=The evening of the second day had already come , when Ar-hap arrived home after weekending amongst a tribe of rebellious subjects .
#Text=But any imposing State entry which might have been intended was rendered impossible by the heat and the threat of that baleful world in the western sky .
#Text=It was a lurid but disordered spectacle which I witnessed from my room in the gate-house just after nightfall .

#Text=The returning army had apparently fallen away exhausted on its march through the town ; only some three hundred of the bodyguard straggled up the hill , limp and sweating , behind a group of pennons , in the midst of which rode a horseman whose commanding presence and splendid war harness impressed me , though I could not make out his features ; a wild , impressionist scene of black outlines , tossing headgear , and spears glittering and vanishing in front of the red glare in the sky , but nothing more .

#Text=Even the dry throats of the suitors in the courtyard hardly mustered a husky cry of welcome as the cavalcade trooped into the enclosure , and then the shadows enfolded them up in silence , and , too hot and listless to care much what the morrow brought forth , I threw myself on the bare floor , tossing and turning in a vain endeavour to sleep until dawn came once more .

#Text=A thin mist which fell with daybreak drew a veil over the horrible glare in the west for an hour or two , and taking advantage of the slight alleviation of heat , I rose and went into the gardens to enjoy a dip in a pool , making , with its surrounding jungle of flowers , one of the pleasantest things about the wood-king 's forest citadel .
#Text=The very earth seemed scorched and baking underfoot -- and the pool was gone !
#Text=It had run as dry as a limekiln ; nothing remained of the pretty fall which had fed it but a miserable trickle of drops from the cascade above .

#Text=Down beyond the town shone a gleam of water where the bitter canal steamed and simmered in the first grey of the morning , but up here six months of scorching drought could not have worked more havoc .
#Text=The very leaves were dropping from the trees , and the luxuriant growths of the day before looked as though a simoon had played upon them .
#Text=I staggered back in disgust , and found some show of official activity about the palace .

#Text=It was the king 's custom , it appeared , to hear petitions and redress wrongs as soon after his return as possible , but today the ceremony was to be cut short as his majesty was going out with all his court to a neighbouring mountain to " pray away the comet , " which by this time was causing dire alarm all through the city .
#Text=" Heaven 's own particular blessing on his prayers , my friend , " I said to the man who told me this .

#Text=" Unless his majesty 's orisons are fruitful , we shall all be cooked like baked potatoes before nightfall , and though I have faced many kinds of death , that is not the one I would choose by preference .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= Not only may you be heard , sir , but you are summoned .

_	_	_	_

#Text= So be it , " I said , too hot to care what happened .

#Text=I lost my luggage check some time ago , but if you will wait outside I will be with you in a moment .
